Posts.Content: Shortly after completing chemotherapy, I began to experience "all over pain." After years of trying to track down a reason, I was diagnosed with fibromyalgia. Fibromyalgia will not show up in bone scans or the such; it won't show up in a blood work up. A rheumetologist or internist familiar with the syndrome can perform a physical pressure point test to determine if fibromyalgia might be the cause of your "all over pain."
Posts.Title: All Over Pain
